meanings.definition: To apply smoke or fumes to in order to disinfect or eradicate pests.
meanings.sent1: The exterminator will fumigate the house to get rid of the bugs.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often fumigate their crops to protect them from harmful insects.
meanings.sent3: The ants in the kitchen were so scared of the fumigation, they packed their bags and left!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to fumigate the entire garden of weeds was like a warrior fighting a battle.
meanings.sent5: The thick smoke used to fumigate the room made it look like a mysterious fog had descended.

meanings.definition: To subject to the action of smoke or fumes for the purpose of disinfection.
meanings.sent1: The hospital will fumigate the room after the patient with a contagious illness leaves.
meanings.sent2: It is important to fumigate old books to prevent the spread of mold.
meanings.sent3: The idea of fumigating the attic to scare away the ghosts was both funny and clever.
meanings.sent4: The chef's secret recipe seemed to fumigate the entire kitchen with delicious aromas.
meanings.sent5: The decision to fumigate the warehouse saved the stored goods from decay.
